sen.j: 宿場（しゅくば）とは、主に江戸時代、五街道や脇往還において駅逓司を取扱うため設定された町場をいう。
sen.e: Shukuba were urban areas established along Go-kaido Road (Edo Five Routes) and Wakiokan (secondary route that connected the Five Routes) to deal with officers who transported luggage from one post-station to another mainly in the Edo period.

Shukuba refers to urban areas that were established mainly during the Edo period along the Go-kaido Road (Edo Five Routes) and Wakiokan (secondary route that connected the Five Routes) to look after officers who transported luggage from one post station to another.
sen.cmt: to deal withという表現が不自然でした。
sen.e: Shukuba refers to urban areas that were established mainly during the Edo period along the Go-kaido Road (Edo Five Routes) and Wakiokan (secondary route that connected the Five Routes) to look after officers who transported luggage from one post station to another.

sen.j: 宿駅ともいい、古代、奈良時代・平安時代から駅宿駅としての「駅」・伝馬の制度によって整備されていった。
sen.e: They were also called shukueki and had been developed by the system of 'Eki' (staging posts on the kaido) or Tenma (post-horses) since the Nara and Kyoto period.

Also referred to as shukueki, they had been maintained as post stations under the system of 'Eki' (staging posts on the kaido) and Tenma (post-horses) since the ancient and medieval times, the Nara period, and the Heian Period.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。古代や平安時代が抜けておりました。Kyoto periodという訳の根拠が不明です。
sen.e: Also referred to as shukueki, they had been maintained as post stations under the system of 'Eki' (staging posts on the kaido) and Tenma (post-horses) since the ancient and medieval times, the Nara period, and the Heian Period.

sen.j: また、宿場を中心に形成された町を宿場町（しゅくばまち）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: And towns formed with Shukuba at their center were called shukuba-machi
In addition, towns that were built around shukuba were referred to as shukuba-machi.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正し、文末に「.」(ピリオド）を追記致しました。
sen.e: In addition, towns that were built around shukuba were referred to as shukuba-machi.

sen.j: 近世の宿場の整備は徳川家康によって関ヶ原の戦い後に始められ、先ず東海道、続いて中山道と順次進められていった。
sen.e: Shukuba in modern times were developed by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the Battle of Sekigahara, and the development started with Tokai-do Road and proceeded to Nakasen-do Road consecutively.

Shukuba during the early-modern times were developed by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the Battle of Sekigahara, and it began on the Tokai-do Road, then the Nakasen-do Road, and had continued one after another.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: Shukuba during the early-modern times were developed by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the Battle of Sekigahara, and it began on the Tokai-do Road, then the Nakasen-do Road, and had continued one after another.

sen.j: 東海道では、1601年（慶長6）に品川から大津までを53駅と定め、ここに東海道五十三次が始まった。
sen.e: Along the Tokai-do Road, 53 stations from Shinagawa to Otsu were established in 1601, which was the beginning of the Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi (Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido).
In 1601, 53 shukuba from Shinagawa to Otsu were established along the Tokai-do Road, and it was here that the Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi (Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido) originated.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: In 1601, 53 shukuba from Shinagawa to Otsu were established along the Tokai-do Road, and it was here that the Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi (Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido) originated.

sen.j: しかし、全部が一度に設置されたわけではなく、順次整備されて最後に庄野宿ができたのは、1624年（寛文元）だった。
sen.e: However, all the stations were not established simultaneously, but were developed one by one, and the last station, Shono-juku was completed in 1624.
However, they were not established all at once, but were developed one by one, and it was 1624 when the last Shono-juku was completed.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: However, they were not established all at once, but were developed one by one, and it was 1624 when the last Shono-juku was completed.

sen.j: 宿場では公用人馬継立てのため定められた人馬を常備し、不足のときには助郷を徴するようになった。
sen.e: Shukuba always had designated number of relay horses and riders available for official transportation, and when they were in short supply, sukego (labor which was imposed on neighboring villages to help the primarily imposed village) was called out.

Shukuba always had designated riders and horses available that would work in relays for official transportation, and when they ran short, sukego (labor which was imposed on neighboring villages to help the primarily imposed village) was sought.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: Shukuba always had designated riders and horses available that would work in relays for official transportation, and when they ran short, sukego (labor which was imposed on neighboring villages to help the primarily imposed village) was sought.

sen.j: また、公武の宿泊、休憩のため問屋場、本陣、脇本陣などがおかれた。
sen.e: For court nobles and samurai to stay and rest, toiyaba (administration office), honjin (officially appointed inn) and waki honjin (sub-honjin) were also established.
In addition, toiyaba (administration office), honjin (officially appointed inn), and waki honjin (sub-honjin) were established for court nobles and samurai to stay and rest.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: In addition, toiyaba (administration office), honjin (officially appointed inn), and waki honjin (sub-honjin) were established for court nobles and samurai to stay and rest.

sen.j: これらの公用のための労役、業務については利益を上げることは難しかったが、幕府は地子免許、各種給米の支給、拝借金貸与など種々の特典を与えることによって、宿場の保護育成に努めた。
sen.e: It was difficult to make a profit out of these official labor and business, but the Edo shogunate made efforts to preserve and develop shukuba by giving various privileges such as Jishimenkyo, distribution of various rices, and loans.
sen.cmt: 地子免許＝Jishimenkyo 拝借金貸与＝loans 定訳不明
sen.e: Increasing profit by these official services and business was difficult, but the Edo shogunate made efforts in preserving and developing shukuba by granting various privileges such as Jishimenkyo, distribution of rice as various salary, and loans.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: Increasing profit by these official services and business was difficult, but the Edo shogunate made efforts in preserving and developing shukuba by granting various privileges such as Jishimenkyo, distribution of rice as various salary, and loans.

sen.j: ほかに一般旅行者を対象とする旅籠、木賃宿、茶屋、商店などが立並び、その宿泊、通行、荷物輸送などで利益をあげた。
sen.e: There was also a row of hatago (inns), kichin yado (cheap lodging houses), chaya (teahouses), and shops for civilian travelers, which benefited from staying and passing of the travelers and transportation of goods

Hatago (inns), kichin yado (cheap lodging houses), chaya (teahouses), and shops for civilian travelers also stood side by side, and they earned profit out of the stay, crossing of the travelers, and transportation of goods.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。また、文末に「.」(ピリオド）を追記致しました。
sen.e: Hatago (inns), kichin yado (cheap lodging houses), chaya (teahouses), and shops for civilian travelers also stood side by side, and they earned profit out of the stay, crossing of the travelers, and transportation of goods.

sen.j: また、高札場も設けられていた。
sen.e: There was also a place to put up Kosatsu (street bulletin board).
There was also a place to put up Kosatsu (street bulletin board).
There was also a place to put up Kosatsu (street bulletin board).

sen.j: 明治時代以降、鉄道開通などによって交通事情が変わってくると通行する人も少なくなり、衰微していった。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, the traffic situation changed due to the beginning of railway service and other reasons, and shukuba declined as passengers decreased.
After the Meiji period, the traffic situation changed due to the start of railway service and so on, and shukuba declined as passengers decreased.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, the traffic situation changed due to the start of railway service and so on, and shukuba declined as passengers decreased.

sen.j: - 人馬の継立、助郷賦課などの業務を行った。
sen.e: They relayed horses and people, and imposed sukego
Performed tasks such as providing men and horses to work in relay and gathered sukego.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。また、文末に「.」(ピリオド）を追記致しました。助郷賦課について、それが助郷から何か金銭的な面で徴収をしていたのか、ただ労務を負担させていたのか、調べきれず申し訳ありません。
sen.e: Performed tasks such as providing men and horses to work in relay and gathered sukego.

sen.j: - 武士や公家用が宿泊・休憩をした。
sen.e: Samurai and court nobles stayed and rested.
Samurai and court nobles stayed and rested.
Samurai and court nobles stayed and rested.

sen.j: 商業的な宿泊施設ではなく、その地の富裕者の邸宅が本陣として指定されることが多かった。
sen.e: Not commercial accommodations but residences of the rich in the area were often designated as honjin
It was not accommodations for commercial purposes, and residences of the wealthy in the area were often appointed as honjin.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: It was not accommodations for commercial purposes, and residences of the wealthy in the area were often appointed as honjin.

sen.j: - 本陣に次ぐ武士や公家の宿泊施設だが、空いているときは一般旅行者も泊めた。
sen.e: They were accommodations for samurai and court nobles second to honjin, but accommodated civilian travelers when rooms were available.
It was accommodations for samurai and court nobles that were secondary to honjin, but lodged civilian travelers when rooms were available.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正致しました。
sen.e: It was accommodations for samurai and court nobles that were secondary to honjin, but lodged civilian travelers when rooms were available.

sen.j: - 一般旅行者用の食事付き宿泊施設。
sen.e: Accommodations with meals for civilian travelers.
Accommodations with meals for civilian travelers.
Accommodations with meals for civilian travelers.

sen.j: - 一般旅行者用の自炊宿泊施設。
sen.e: Accommodations with cooking facilities for civilian travelers.
Accommodations with cooking facilities for civilian travelers.
Accommodations with cooking facilities for civilian travelers.

sen.j: - 旅人向けの休憩場で、お茶、一膳飯、お酒などを売っているところ。
sen.e: Rest houses for travelers where tea, simple meals and alcohol were available.
Rest houses for travelers where tea, simple meals, and alcohol were sold.
sen.cmt: andの前にカンマを付しました。
sen.e: Rest houses for travelers where tea, simple meals, and alcohol were sold.

tit.cmt: 日本語の読みで表記をした方がよいという考えです。

sen.j: - 旅人向けに商いをする店。
sen.e: Shops for travelers.
Shops for travelers.
Shops for travelers.

sen.j: - 幕府からの禁制や通達事項などをしるした高札を掲げた場所。
sen.e: Places to put up a notice board on which bans and notifications from bakufu were written.
Places to put up a notice board on which bans and notifications from bakufu were written.
Places to put up a notice board on which bans and notifications from bakufu were written.

sen.j: - 宿場の両端の街道をクランク (道路)状に曲げた場所。
sen.e: Places bent like a crank at both ends of the kaido (road) in a shukuba
Places bent like a crank at both ends of the kaido (road) in a shukuba.
sen.cmt: 文末に「.」(ピリオド）を追記致しました。
sen.e: Places bent like a crank at both ends of the kaido (road) in a shukuba.

sen.j: 外敵を迎え撃つための、一種のシケイン。
sen.e: These were kind of chicane to intercept external enemies
These were a kind of chicane to intercept external enemies.
sen.cmt: a kind ofに修正し、文末に「.」(ピリオド）を追記致しました。
sen.e: These were a kind of chicane to intercept external enemies.

sen.j: - 宿場の端（見附付近）に設けられ、木戸と木戸の間（見附と見附の間）が宿場町とされた。
sen.e: They were set up at both ends (around mitsuke) of a shukuba, and the area between the kido was regarded as a shukuba-machi Town.
They were set up at both ends (around mitsuke) of a shukuba, and the area between the kido was regarded as a shukuba-machi.
sen.cmt: Townを削除致しました。用語統一の通りShukuba-machiでOKだと思います。
sen.e: They were set up at both ends (around mitsuke) of a shukuba, and the area between the kido was regarded as a shukuba-machi.

sen.j: 木戸のほかに常夜灯が設置されている場合もあった。
sen.e: Some shukuba-machi Town had all-night lights other than kido.
Other than kido, some shukuba-machi had lights that lit all through the night.
Other than kido, some shukuba-machi had lights that lit all through the night.

sen.j: またほとんどの場合、夜間は防犯などの目的で閉鎖されていた。
sen.e: In most cases, kido were closed at night for security reasons.
In most cases, kido were closed at night for security reasons.
In most cases, kido were closed at night for security reasons.

sen.j: 宿場の保存・復元
sen.e: Preservation and restoration of shukuba
Preservation and restoration of shukuba
Preservation and restoration of shukuba

sen.j: 国選定重要伝統的建造物群保存地区
sen.e: Nation's Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings
Nationally-selected Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings
sen.cmt: Nation's部分の表現をより自然なものになるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: Nationally-selected Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings

sen.j: 旧会津西街道 大内宿 （福島県南会津郡下郷町）
sen.e: Ouchi-juku Station on the old Aizunishi-kaido Road (Shimogo-machi, Minami Aizu-gun, Fukushima Prefecture)
Ouchi-juku on the old Aizunishi-kaido Road (Shimogo-machi, Minami Aizu-gun, Fukushima Prefecture)
sen.cmt: (とSの間にあるスペース削除致しました。また、宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: Ouchi-juku on the old Aizunishi-kaido Road (Shimogo-machi, Minami Aizu-gun, Fukushima Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧北国街道 海野宿 （長野県東御市）
sen.e: Unno-juku Station on the old Hokkoku-kiado Road (Tomi City, Nagano Prefecture)
Unno-juku on the old Hokkoku-kiado Road (Tomi City, Nagano Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: Unno-juku on the old Hokkoku-kiado Road (Tomi City, Nagano Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧中山道 奈良井宿 （長野県塩尻市）
sen.e: Narai-juku Station on the old Nakasen-do Road (Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture)
Narai-juku on the old Nakasen-do Road (Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: Narai-juku on the old Nakasen-do Road (Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧中山道 妻籠宿 （長野県木曽郡南木曽町）
sen.e: Tsumago-juku Station on the old Nakasen-do Road (Nagiso-cho, Kiso-gun, Nagano Prefecture)
Tsumago-juku on the old Nakasen-do Road (Nagiso-cho, Kiso-gun, Nagano Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: Tsumago-juku on the old Nakasen-do Road (Nagiso-cho, Kiso-gun, Nagano Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧東海道 関宿 （三重県亀山市）
sen.e: Seki-juku Station on the old Tokai-do Road (Kameyama City, Mie Prefecture)
Seki-juku on the old Tokai-do Road (Kameyama City, Mie Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。
sen.e: Seki-juku on the old Tokai-do Road (Kameyama City, Mie Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧鯖街道 熊川宿 （福井県三方上中郡若狭町）
sen.e: Kumagawa-shuku Station on the old Saba-kaido Road (Wakasa-cho, Mikatakaminaka-gun, Fukui Prefecture)
Kumagawa-shuku on the old Saba-kaido Road (Wakasa-cho, Mikatakaminaka-gun, Fukui Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。

sen.j: 旧因幡街道 平福 （兵庫県佐用郡佐用町）
sen.e: Hirafuku on the old Inaba-kaido Road (Sayo-cho, Sayo-gun, Hyogo Prefecture)
Hirafuku on the old Inaba-kaido Road (Sayo-cho, Sayo-gun, Hyogo Prefecture)
Hirafuku on the old Inaba-kaido Road (Sayo-cho, Sayo-gun, Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧因幡街道 大原宿 （岡山県美作市）
sen.e: Ohara-shuku Station on the old Inaba-kaido Road (Mimasaka City, Okayama Prefecture)
Ohara-shuku on the old Inaba-kaido Road (Mimasaka City, Okayama Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 宿名のあとにStationは不要と考え、削除致しました。

sen.j: 旧因幡街道 智頭宿 （鳥取県八頭郡智頭町）
sen.e: Chizu-shuku Station on the old Inaba-kaido Road (chizu-cho, Yazu-gun, Tottori Prefecture)
Chizu-shuku on the old Inaba-kaido Road (Chizu-cho, Yazu-gun, Tottori Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧若桜街道 若桜宿 （鳥取県八頭郡若桜町）
sen.e: Wakasa-juku Station on the old Wakasa-kaido Road (Wakasa-cho, Yazu-gun, Tottori Prefecture)
Wakasa-juku on the old Wakasa-kaido Road (Wakasa-cho, Yazu-gun, Tottori Prefecture)

sen.j: 旧東海道 石部宿場の里 （石部宿の復元）（滋賀県湖南市）
sen.e: Ishibe Shukuba no Sato (restoration of Ishibe-juku Station) on the old Tokai-do Road (Konan City, Shiga Prefecture)
Ishibe Shukuba no Sato (restoration of Ishibe-juku Station) on the old Tokai-do Road (Konan City, Shiga Prefecture)
